title: All is not well in Katy Perry's 'Chained to the Rhythm' video
text:
All is not well in Katy Perry's 'Chained to the Rhythm' video Kelly Lawler , USA TODAY 9:27 a.m. ET Feb. 21, 2017 2 Shares 
Maybe tomorrow isn't so all it's cracked up to be. 
In the new video for Katy Perry's Chained to the Rhythm , the pop star finds herself in a Tomorrowland -like retro-futuristic theme park complete with Jetsons style costumes, 1950s type set pieces and a movie on the "nuclear family." But the candy-colored amusement park is not all that it seems. 
Over the course of the video, the nefarious side of the park starts to come out, from the thorn that pricks Perry to the human-sized hamster wheel the park-goers are running in. 
Perry debuted Chained to the Rhythm, which includes a verse from Bob Marleyâ€™s grandson Skip, earlier this month and performed it live at the Grammys shortly after. That performance also featured Americana set-pieces and political overtones . The singer wore a "PERSIST" armband (in reference to Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren) and performed in front of a backdrop of the Constitution. Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2m41bCe Most Popular
